# Typography

import { DarkModeCompatible } from '@site/src/components/DarkModeCompatible';

<DarkModeCompatible />

Text component for consistent typography, semantics, and color. Provides flexible rendering of headings, body text, labels, and captions with semantic HTML and accessible styling.

## Overview

Use `Typography` when you need…

- Consistent text styling across your application
- Semantic HTML via `as` with independent visual styling via `variant`
- Flexible typography (headings, body, labels, captions)
- Semantic color variants via `color`
- Customizable weight and alignment via `weight` and `align`

## Live Demo

<LiveDemo />

## Import

```tsx
import { Typography } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';
```

## Basic Usage

```tsx
<Typography variant="h2">Heading</Typography>
<Typography variant="body" color="secondary">
  Supporting text
</Typography>
```

## Anatomy

The Typography component provides semantic text rendering with visual flexibility:

```
┌──────────────────────────────────────┐
│  Text Content                        │  ← Typography Container
└──────────────────────────────────────┘
     ↑
     └─ Rendered as semantic HTML element
        (h1-h6, p, span, label, div)
```

**Component Structure:**

- **Container**: Semantic HTML element (default based on variant, override with `as`)
- **Content**: Text or inline elements (children)
- **Styling**: Applied via CSS classes based on variant, weight, align, and color

**Visual Variants:**

- **Headings**: h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6 (large to small heading styles)
- **Body Text**: bodyLarge, body, bodySmall (paragraph text in different sizes)
- **Specialized**: label (form labels), caption (small secondary text)

**Color Variants:**

- **primary**: Default text color (high contrast)
- **secondary**: Slightly muted text (medium contrast)
- **tertiary**: More muted text (lower contrast for hints/captions)
- **inverse**: Inverted color for dark backgrounds
- **error**: Red text for error messages
- **success**: Green text for success messages
- **warning**: Orange/amber text for warnings

## API Reference

### Props

| Prop        | Type                                                                                                           | Default     | Description            |
| ----------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------- | ---------------------- |
| `children`  | `ReactNode`                                                                                                    | Required    | Text content           |
| `as`        | `'h1' \| 'h2' \| 'h3' \| 'h4' \| 'h5' \| 'h6' \| 'p' \| 'span' \| 'label' \| 'div'`                            | Auto        | HTML element to render |
| `variant`   | `'h1' \| 'h2' \| 'h3' \| 'h4' \| 'h5' \| 'h6' \| 'body' \| 'bodyLarge' \| 'bodySmall' \| 'caption' \| 'label'` | `'body'`    | Visual style variant   |
| `weight`    | `'light' \| 'normal' \| 'medium' \| 'semibold' \| 'bold'`                                                      | -           | Font weight            |
| `align`     | `'left' \| 'center' \| 'right' \| 'justify'`                                                                   | -           | Text alignment         |
| `color`     | `'primary' \| 'secondary' \| 'tertiary' \| 'inverse' \| 'error' \| 'success' \| 'warning'`                     | `'primary'` | Semantic color variant |
| `className` | `string`                                                                                                       | -           | Additional CSS classes |

Also supports all standard HTML attributes for the rendered element (e.g., `id`, `aria-*`, `data-*`).

### Variant Details

**Headings:**

- **h1**: Largest heading (48px, for page titles)
- **h2**: Section heading (36px, for main sections)
- **h3**: Subsection heading (28px, for subsections)
- **h4**: Small heading (24px, for cards/panels)
- **h5**: Tiny heading (20px, rarely used)
- **h6**: Smallest heading (18px, rarely used)

**Body Text:**

- **bodyLarge**: Large body text (18px, for emphasis or leads)
- **body**: Default body text (16px, main content - default)
- **bodySmall**: Small body text (14px, secondary content)

**Specialized:**

- **label**: Form labels (14px, medium weight)
- **caption**: Captions and hints (12px, small annotations)

### Default HTML Elements

When `as` is not provided, the component renders a semantic element based on `variant`:

| Variant   | Default Element |
| --------- | --------------- |
| `h1`      | `<h1>`          |
| `h2`      | `<h2>`          |
| `h3`      | `<h3>`          |
| `h4`      | `<h4>`          |
| `h5`      | `<h5>`          |
| `h6`      | `<h6>`          |
| `body*`   | `<p>`           |
| `label`   | `<span>`        |
| `caption` | `<span>`        |

### Weight Details

- **light**: Lighter weight (300)
- **normal**: Normal weight (400, default for body)
- **medium**: Medium weight (500)
- **semibold**: Semi-bold weight (600, default for headings)
- **bold**: Bold weight (700)

### Align Details

- **left**: Left-aligned text (default)
- **center**: Center-aligned text
- **right**: Right-aligned text
- **justify**: Justified text (equal width)

### Color Details

- **primary**: Default text color (highest contrast)
- **secondary**: Muted text color (medium contrast)
- **tertiary**: More muted text (lower contrast)
- **inverse**: Light text for dark backgrounds
- **error**: Red text for errors and destructive actions
- **success**: Green text for success states
- **warning**: Orange/amber text for warnings

## Variants

<Variants />

## Best Practices

### Do ✅

- Use semantic HTML (let `variant` determine element, or use `as` explicitly)
- Maintain heading hierarchy (don't skip levels: h1 → h2 → h3)
- Use `color="secondary"` for supporting text, `color="tertiary"` for hints/captions
- Use `as` to separate semantics from visual style (e.g., `as="h1" variant="h3"`)
- Keep line length readable (45-75 characters for body text)

### Don't ❌

- Don't skip heading levels (bad: h1 → h3, good: h1 → h2 → h3)
- Don't use multiple h1 elements per page (harms SEO and accessibility)
- Don't use color alone to convey meaning (combine with text/icons)
- Don't override font families (use design system tokens)

## Accessibility

The Typography component is designed with WCAG 2.1 AA compliance in mind:

### Heading Hierarchy

Maintain proper heading structure for screen readers and SEO:

```tsx
<Typography variant="h1">Page Title</Typography>
<Typography variant="h2">Section 1</Typography>
<Typography variant="h3">Subsection 1.1</Typography>
<Typography variant="h3">Subsection 1.2</Typography>
<Typography variant="h2">Section 2</Typography>
```

**Separating Semantics from Styling:**

```tsx
{
  /* Visual h3 style but semantic h1 for SEO */
}
<Typography as="h1" variant="h3">
  Compact Page Title
</Typography>;
```

### Readable Line Length

Keep line length between 45-75 characters for optimal readability:

```tsx
{
  /* Good: Constrained width */
}
<div style={{ maxWidth: '65ch' }}>
  <Typography variant="body">This text will wrap at a comfortable reading width...</Typography>
</div>;
```

### Keyboard Navigation

All Typography content is accessible to keyboard users:

- **Tab**: Navigate to interactive elements within text (links, buttons)
- Text content itself is not focusable (as expected for static text)

### Screen Reader Support

**For Headings:**

```tsx
<Typography variant="h2">Account Settings</Typography>
// Screen reader announces: "Account Settings, heading level 2"
```

**For Body Text:**

```tsx
<Typography variant="body">Welcome to the application.</Typography>
// Screen reader announces: "Welcome to the application."
```

**For Labels:**

```tsx
<Typography as="label" htmlFor="email" variant="label">
  Email Address
</Typography>
// Screen reader announces: "Email Address" (associated with input)
```

**For Color Variants:**

```tsx
<Typography color="error">Password is required</Typography>
// Screen reader announces: "Password is required"
// Note: Color alone doesn't convey meaning to screen readers
```

### Best Practices for Accessibility

#### Do ✅

- Use semantic heading elements (h1-h6) for page structure
- Maintain heading hierarchy (don't skip levels)
- Use only one h1 per page
- Associate labels with form inputs using `htmlFor` or wrapping
- Ensure sufficient line height for readability (default: 1.5 for body)
- Keep line length between 45-75 characters
- Combine color with text to convey meaning (not color alone)

#### Don't ❌

- Don't skip heading levels (h1 → h3)
- Don't use headings only for visual styling (use `variant` for styling, `as` for semantics)
- Don't use multiple h1 elements per page
- Don't rely on color alone to convey meaning
- Don't use very long lines (harder to read)
- Don't use center/justify alignment for long text (reduces readability)

### ARIA Attributes

The component supports all standard ARIA attributes:

```tsx
<Typography variant="body" role="status" aria-live="polite">
  Your changes have been saved.
</Typography>
```

**For Form Labels:**

```tsx
<Typography as="label" htmlFor="username" variant="label">
  Username
</Typography>
<input id="username" type="text" />
```

**For Error Messages:**

```tsx
<Typography
  color="error"
  role="alert"
  id="error-message"
>
  Invalid email format
</Typography>
<input type="email" aria-describedby="error-message" />
```

### Color Contrast

All Typography color variants meet WCAG 2.1 AA contrast requirements:

- **primary**: Minimum 4.5:1 contrast ratio (7:1 in most cases)
- **secondary**: Minimum 4.5:1 contrast ratio
- **tertiary**: Minimum 4.5:1 contrast ratio (meets AA for large text)
- **inverse**: Minimum 4.5:1 contrast ratio (on dark backgrounds)
- **error/success/warning**: Minimum 4.5:1 contrast ratio

Tested in both light and dark modes.

## Common Patterns

### Article Content

```tsx title="src/components/Article.tsx"
import { Typography } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function Article() {
  return (
    <article style={{ maxWidth: '65ch' }}>
      <Typography variant="h1">Understanding React Hooks</Typography>

      <Typography variant="bodyLarge" color="secondary">
        A comprehensive guide to modern React development
      </Typography>

      <Typography variant="body">
        React Hooks revolutionized how we write components by allowing function components to use state and lifecycle
        features.
      </Typography>

      <Typography variant="h2">Getting Started</Typography>

      <Typography variant="body">The most commonly used hooks are useState and useEffect...</Typography>

      <Typography variant="caption" color="tertiary">
        Published on January 14, 2026
      </Typography>
    </article>
  );
}
```

### Heading Hierarchy

```tsx title="src/components/ProductPage.tsx"
import { Typography } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function ProductPage() {
  return (
    <>
      <Typography variant="h1">Product Name</Typography>

      <Typography variant="h2">Features</Typography>
      <Typography variant="h3">Core Features</Typography>
      <Typography variant="body">Feature descriptions...</Typography>

      <Typography variant="h3">Advanced Features</Typography>
      <Typography variant="body">More feature descriptions...</Typography>

      <Typography variant="h2">Specifications</Typography>
      <Typography variant="body">Technical details...</Typography>
    </>
  );
}
```

### Inline Code and Mixed Content

```tsx title="src/components/CodeExample.tsx"
import { Typography } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function CodeExample() {
  return (
    <Typography variant="body">
      Use the <code>useState</code> hook to add state to function components. For example:{' '}
      <code>const [count, setCount] = useState(0)</code>
    </Typography>
  );
}
```

### Body Text with Links

```tsx title="src/components/TermsText.tsx"
import { Typography } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function TermsText() {
  return (
    <>
      <Typography variant="body">
        By signing up, you agree to our <a href="/terms">Terms of Service</a> and <a href="/privacy">Privacy Policy</a>.
      </Typography>

      <Typography variant="bodySmall" color="secondary">
        We'll never share your information with third parties.
      </Typography>
    </>
  );
}
```

### Truncated Text

```tsx title="src/components/TruncatedText.tsx"
import { Typography } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function TruncatedText({ text }: { text: string }) {
  return (
    <Typography
      variant="body"
      style={{
        overflow: 'hidden',
        textOverflow: 'ellipsis',
        whiteSpace: 'nowrap',
        maxWidth: '300px',
      }}
      title={text}
    >
      {text}
    </Typography>
  );
}
```

### Form Labels with Typography

```tsx title="src/components/FormField.tsx"
import { Typography } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function FormField() {
  return (
    <div>
      <Typography as="label" htmlFor="email" variant="label">
        Email Address
      </Typography>
      <input id="email" type="email" />

      <Typography variant="caption" color="tertiary">
        We'll never share your email with anyone else.
      </Typography>
    </div>
  );
}
```

### Status Messages

```tsx title="src/components/StatusMessages.tsx"
import { Typography } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function StatusMessages() {
  return (
    <>
      <Typography color="success" role="status">
        Your profile has been updated successfully.
      </Typography>

      <Typography color="error" role="alert">
        Failed to save changes. Please try again.
      </Typography>

      <Typography color="warning">Your subscription will expire in 3 days.</Typography>
    </>
  );
}
```

### Separating Semantics from Visual Style

```tsx title="src/components/CardHeader.tsx"
import { Typography } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function CardHeader() {
  return (
    <>
      {/* Semantic h1 but visually styled as h3 */}
      <Typography as="h1" variant="h3">
        Welcome Back
      </Typography>

      {/* Semantic h2 but visually styled as body */}
      <Typography as="h2" variant="body" color="secondary">
        Continue where you left off
      </Typography>
    </>
  );
}
```

## Related Components

- **Link** - For navigation links with underline styling
- **Anchor** - For in-page anchor links
- **Card** - Often uses Typography for title and description
- **Stack** - For organizing typography with consistent spacing

## TypeScript Support

The Typography component is fully typed with TypeScript:

```tsx
import type { ElementType, HTMLAttributes, ReactNode } from 'react';

type TypographyElement = 'h1' | 'h2' | 'h3' | 'h4' | 'h5' | 'h6' | 'p' | 'span' | 'label' | 'div';

export type TypographyProps = {
  as?: TypographyElement;
  variant?: 'h1' | 'h2' | 'h3' | 'h4' | 'h5' | 'h6' | 'body' | 'bodyLarge' | 'bodySmall' | 'caption' | 'label';
  weight?: 'light' | 'normal' | 'medium' | 'semibold' | 'bold';
  align?: 'left' | 'center' | 'right' | 'justify';
  color?: 'primary' | 'secondary' | 'tertiary' | 'inverse' | 'error' | 'success' | 'warning';
  children: ReactNode;
} & HTMLAttributes<HTMLElement>;
```

This ensures type safety and autocomplete in your IDE.
